poem:
### The Wild West of Want

In this modern tumbleweed town,  
needles whisper promises,  
under neon suns of desire.  
Slim silhouettes dance on screens,  
while merchants in digital saloons  
exchange gold for the weight of dreams.  
A pharmacopeia rodeo where  
the price of less is more,  
and loss itself is gained  
with a shot in the dark.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Wild west’: experts concerned by illegal promotion of weight-loss jabs in UK Weight-loss injections are being aggressively marketed to British consumers through often illegal promotions, in a practice experts have described as a “wild west” industry of drug selling. The booming market for jabs such as Wegovy and Mounjaro has triggered a price battle among online pharmacies, with even high-street chains cashing in on the soaring demand. Last month, the pharmaceutical company Novo Nordisk revealed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

Last month, the pharmaceutical company Novo Nordisk revealed
